runs.comm: good length, 132 kph, pitching just outside off and seaming away, Gunathilaka lets it go

edged and just wide of second slip, though Anderson dived full length to his left. there's a third man so just the single. Gunathilaka had prodded away from his body as the good length ball moved away from him
reaches for a wide one outside off and hits it to mid-off, no timing on that shot
pitches on a good length around off and comes back into the right-hander, Dilshan plays it back to the bowler
steps out of his crease but jumped too far outside leg stump to reach a ball that speeds through outside off
turned of the pads to fine leg for a single, tight start from Boult
a full ball on the pads from Milne, clipped to fine leg for a single
steps towards leg to make room and flays at the length ball outside off, slicing it over the point fielder and to the boundary
full and straight, flicked through midwicket this time
lofts the ball without any proper timing, McClenaghan is slow to move back from mid-on and can't reach it as it drops over his head
steered towards third man for a single

bowled him! Gunathilaka tries to slog across the line at a good length ball on a wicket to wicket line. He just cleared his front foot and swung hard. He missed, Milne hit. That wasn't pretty at all from Gunathilaka
another slog across the line and Dilshan is beaten
full ball angling across the right-hander, Dilshan drives on the front foot to wide mid-off
length ball on the pads, nudged in front of square leg for a single
opens the face and pushes the ball towards cover point for one more
defended from the crease towards the leg side, short midwicket fields

aren't these batsmen in a hurry today? Jayasuriya charges down the pitch and slogs wildly at a good length ball outside off stump, beaten comprehensively by the slight away movement from a good length
shot! Dilshan gets down low to a length ball on the stumps and paddles it between the keeper and short fine leg
this time he tries the scoop, getting down on one knee over the off stump and trying to scoop the ball over the keeper, he is beaten because the good length ball moves away from him late
Milne bowls the yorker and Dilshan inside edges it through square leg
defended from the crease on the leg side
driven to extra cover on the front foot for one
that's not short at all but Dilshan clears his front foot, winds up and pulls the ball flat over the infield at midwicket
good length around off from McClenaghan from over the wicket, played off the back foot towards point
hit off the back foot into the covers

Dilshan survives! He hand a real slog across the line at a good length ball, definitely not short enough to swipe at. The ball soars off the top edge, swirling down towards third man, Boult has to cover a lot of distance to his left and he never looked comfortable under that ball. In the end he barely gets hands on it
tries another slog and he mis-times it to deep midwicket
cut hard off the back foot but point is in the way
defended from the crease into the off side

another crazy slog, opening up the front foot and heaving with all his might, Dilshan misses the short ball and it thuds off his shoulder and goes past the keeper diving to his right to the third man boundary

what's he done there? Dilshan got into position to scoop but then ended up playing no real shot, the ball hit some part of the bat and went on the leg side, direct hit at the bats,an's end but Jayasuriya is safe. That ball hit the bottom inside edge of the bat as Dilshan aborted the scoop

caught at a deepish mid-off! Jayasuriya targeted the short straight boundary but mis-timed the loft, hitting the good length ball in the air towards Williamson, who back-pedaled and judged it perfectly. That came off the bottom of the bat, because Jayasuriya had to reach for it as it angled across him from over the wicket
swipes across the line at a full and straight ball and gets an inside edge on to the pad on the off side, he's trying to break the ball I think, swinging so hard
short ball and Dilshan hooks it, might have been more of a top edge but the ball bounces once just before going over the fine leg boundary, fielder was in the circle
a full ball swings into the blockhole, Dilshan digs it out on the leg side, Milne dives across to field it himself
played towards short extra cover, Santner runs to his left to field
Chandimal gets down low and outside off and slog sweeps, that ball bounces a lot more than the batsman expected and hits the side of his helmet
the reverse sweep this time, hit towards third man, in the air but safe
caught at short third man! Chandimal clears his front foot and slogs across the line, the length is too full for that shot and the ball lobs off the top edge to Taylor, such a simple catch
defended on the front foot on the off side
defended on the back foot towards the bowler
good length on off, angling across the right-hander, Dilshan plays from his crease towards cover
leans back and cuts a short of a length ball towards third man
Mathews waits on the back foot and cuts the length ball to point
short of a length ball from around the wicket angles into Mathews before straightening off the pitch from around off stump, the batsman fends from his crease and is beaten
nudged from the crease towards square leg
tries to glance the ball behind square but misses and is hit on the pad for a leg bye
goes back and turns the ball through square leg with the angle into him from around the wicket
Mathews steps out to the spinner, he is not to the pitch of the ball but he hits through the line, the bat turned in his hand but the straight boundary is small and the ball clears it
and again, Mathews reaches for the full ball wide outside off and clubs it to the straight boundary, hitting it flat and just over the long-on boundary
a flatter and slightly shorter ball, Mathews works it through square for a quickly run two
tries to hit the ball through midwicket but he gets an inside edge to short fine leg
bowled wide outside off stump, Mathews lets it go thinking it might be called a wide
Dilshan stays in his crease and pushes the ball through midwicket
short and wide outside off stump, Mathews reaches for it and chips it past the keeper and to the third man boundary, deft shot
played behind square leg for a single

Dilshan's frenzied innings has come to a frenzied end. He tried to reverse slog the ball but top edged it just beyond the circle at short third man. McClenaghan back pedals and catches it. Quite poor from Dilshan today, so rash.
defended from the crease towards point
flicked off the pads in front of square leg
defended back to the bowler
nudged off the pads through square leg for a single
strays down leg side, too far away for Siriwardana to connect with the glance

now Siriwardana also falls to the slog, Sri Lanka are imploding spectacularly. Siriwardana swung across the line and mis-timed it so badly that the ball was falling just past the inner circle at wide long-on. Boult came racing in from the long on boundary and caught it on the move, did well to keep his balance
nudged off the pads through square leg for a single
defended on the front foot on the off side
strays down leg side but the umpire does not call it wide, the batsman had moved across his stumps to let the ball go
Taylor dives to his left at backward point to block the firm late cut from Mathews, that was four otherwise
nudged off the pads with the angle into him from around the wicket behind square
short ball, Mathews stays in his crease and pulls in front of square leg
Sri Lanka lose their sixth inside 12 overs, Vithanage aims to launch the ball over the straight boundary. The length isn't full enough and he ends up mis-timing it straight to Milne at long off
angled into the pads from around the wicket, nudged from the crease towards square leg
driven hard but straight to short cover
goes back and towards off and dabs the ball towards midwicket
goes back and plays the ball through square leg this time
steps out and does not get to the pitch of the ball, instead of slogging though, Mathews dabs the ball in front of square leg

nudged off the pads towards square leg, RONCHI runs across to field it, the umpire says no short was offered and calls dead ball. Surely he played a shot there? That's an odd call and it's cost Sri Lanka a run
full toss, driven firmly along the ground on the front foot to long on
played towards midwicket
played into the covers for a single
length ball outside off, Perera goes back and cuts through point
short ball, pulled from the crease towards wide long on
hits the ball down the ground to long off, not timed well, falls well short of the fielder
Mathews charges and slogs the ball in the air towards cow corner, Anderson is going for it from deep midwicket, Milne from long on. Milne is faster and dives to try and catch it but fails
nudged from the crease towards midwicket
shot! Mathews charges a full ball and drives it flat over the long off boundary, that ball might still have been climbing as it cleared the boundary. Hit with a lot of power
pushed off the front foot to long on for a single
short of a length, Perera swivels and pulls the ball hard, once bounce to the fielder at deep square leg
clears his front foot and drives the full ball hard and straight, long-on had to move only a little to his left but had no chance
full toss, Mathews aims for the midwicket boundary but gets a top edge that flies over the fielder at short third man
driven to long on for a single
a full ball on off stump, Mathews drives to long off
another one falls to the slog, Perera aims for the deep midwicket boundary but top edges the ball to long on, where Guptill settles under the catch
Mathews backs away towards leg and chips the ball past the keeper and fine of he man at short third man
driven to long off for a single
Udana gets behind the line of a good length ball and defends with a straight bat to the bowler

caught at extra cover! Udana tries to go over the off side but ends up chipping it to Williamson, who moves to his right and takes the catch. It was the slower ball and he played far too early. Elliott has four wickets!
length ball outside leg, the batsman pulls towards long leg, the fielder at fine leg does well to move quickly to his left
pulled behind square for a single
a full ball in the blockhole outside off, the batsman is beaten
a full toss, driven through covers for a single
full and straight, Mathews drives hard towards the bowler who does well to get down quickly in his follow through and field
short of a length delivery, Mathews pulls off the front foot, along the ground to deep square leg
backs away towards leg, the bowler follows him and beats the bat
jumps outside leg a long way, Milne follows him with a full ball, Mathews squeezes it behind point on the off side cramped for room
full ball on the pads, played to fine leg
another full ball, nearly blockhole length, played to mid on for a single
moves outside leg to make room, the bowler follows him again with a full ball, clipped to midwicket for one more
a low full toss on the pads, clipped to fine leg for a single
a length ball on the pads, Mathews stays back and swats the ball behind square, swiveling quickly
full and wide outside off, the batsman lunges but can't reach it
banged in short, the batsman swivels to play but then aborts the shot, that's over his head so a wide called
beaten on the drive by a fuller length ball outside off
full ball angling into him from around the wicket, driven into the covers, there's a direct hit at the striker's end but the batsman is just safe, Williamson was the fielder
Mathews charges and slogs, and he's slogged well, smashing the offcutter into the stands beyond the long on boundary
pulled behind square leg for a single
Vandersay clears his front foot and slogs at  good length ball, makes no contact and is beaten outside off
backs away outside leg and carves the length ball over point for a boundary to start the over, it was the slower legbreak type ball from Boult
and again! Mathews moves outside leg stump to cut the ball from outside leg stump over Taylor at backward point for four more
backs away outside leg for the third time, the ball is full and straight this time, Mathews reaches for it and hits it into the covers for one
short ball, Vandersay pulls, he top edges it but the ball falls safely at square leg
short of a length ball, Mathews swivels and pulls hard, beating the man at square leg and Elliott won't get across from long leg quickly enough, it was another slow ball
full and wide outside off, Mathews had backed away outside leg and was too far away to play the ball
